EventsDetail.Name: Mountaineering
EventsDetail.Title: Mountaineering
EventsDetail.Abstract: Explore higher ground with Outdoor Activities
EventsDetail.BodyCopy:
"Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean."
-John Muir

Join us for breath taking views from the tops of mountain peaks in Idaho and Wyoming . These are overnight trips that start early and last all day. The hard work is worth the view from the top. These trips will teach the basics of mountain travel and safe route finding in rocky and snowy terrain. The trips are rated strenuous and good physical conditioning is essential.

Middle and South Teton

Date: June 13-14
Departure Time: 4p.m. Friday
Return Time: 9 p.m. Saturday
Cost: $25
Meeting at: ORC (under the North end of the stadium)

Mt. Teewinot

Date: July 19-20
Departure Time: 4p.m. Friday
Return Time: 8 p.m. Saturday
Cost: $25
Meeting at: ORC (under the North end of the stadium)

Sign up at the ticket office or online www.byui.edu/tickets

A mandatory pre-trip meeting will be held on the Thursday night before the trip leaves. 

We hope to see you on the next trip with Outdoor Activities. Please remember that only students or spouse of students can participate.

For More Information Contact

Scott Hurst

hursts@byui.edu

Your ticket fee covers transportation, some meals, and any safety equipment necessary for the trip. You will need to provide the following:

Equipment List

Waterproof Hiking Boots

Gators

Waterproof Shell Pants/Jacket

Synethic or wool pants for general wear.

Gloves- 2 pair

Wool/Synthetic Socks- 2 pair

Warm Hat

Warm Jacket, Sweater, or Fleece

2 qts. Water

Snacks and Lunch

Sunglasses

Sunscreen

Sleeping bag

Tent (shared if possible with another person)

Toiletries/Personal Care Items and Medications

Long Underwear Tops and Bottoms

Camera

Backpack
